headline: Moist Carrot Cake
description: This deliciously moist carrot cake recipe is packed with extra goodies including flaked coconut, crushed pineapple, and chopped walnuts.
name: Moist Carrot Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13-inch pan.
Combine flour, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl; set aside.
Mix sugar, oil, and eggs together in a separate bowl. Beat in flour mixture. Stir in carrots, pineapple, coconut, and walnuts. Pour cake batter into the prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 35 to 40 minutes. Allow to cool.

review.reviewBody: My partner is loves carrot cake but is very fussy about it. He is also sensitive to gluten and very allergic to dairy, so I decided on a whim to give this cake a try using gluten-free flour. I had low expectations, but we both loved it even without the cream cheese frosting. So moist and flavorful. The silver lining of a covid winter with time to try recipes you're not sure will work out.

We loved it! Actually sifted all of the dry ingredients together and then tossed the shredded carrots and coconut in with the dry before adding it to the wet which seemed to help with consistent distribution of the goodies!

Too wet and oily. Reduce applesauce to 1/2 cup and oil to 1/2 or 1/3. Temperature top Low: change to 180degC for 40mins. The pineapple sauce has not enough acid to react with baking soda. Leaving a metal taste. Don’t use soda and use more baking powder if need. Acid from fruits are too uncertain to completely neutralise baking soda perfectly.
I Increased the carrots to 4 cups. Did not add walnuts or coconut
Very moist cake. I added 1/2 cup of soaked raisins and a pinch of Nutmeg. My family loved it and told me it's a keeper for sure.
I baked it twice as long as was called for, it never baked in the middle. Fell apart. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone

Great base recipe. Here's the changes I made for the best carrot cake ever. Flour: add 1 cup for a total of 3 cups. Baking powder and soda: 1 teaspoon and 3/4 teaspoon. Pineapple: drain well and add 3/4 cups. Add 1 cup of Almond meal. Walnuts: crush before adding. Sugar: substitute with brown sugar and reduce to 3/4 cups. Flavouring: add 1 teaspoon vanilla, reduce cinnamon to 3/4 teaspoons, add 1/2 teaspoon cloves, 3/4 teaspoons nutmeg. Coconut: reduce to 1/2 cup. Oil: reduce to 3/4 cups.
This was the moistest carrot cake I’ve ever eaten. I reduced the oil to 1 cup based on reviews. But I would use 3/4 cup if I make it again.
Excellent recipe! Love the coconut!
Baking time is much longer than indicated. At 40 minutes, in the correct size pan, the cake was basically raw. Upped the time to 1hr, 15 minutes. Taste was excellent!

As is, with no alterations, this recipe is perfect. Best dang carrot cake I’ve ever had. Am I the only one who thinks that if you didn’t follow the recipe, you have no business leaving a review for it Especially if you didn’t follow the recipe initially and then decide to alter the ingredients based on that and you’ve never even made this recipe. I want reviews of this recipe, and I can’t find one. Because you all made some other recipe, you didn’t make this recipe.

Look no further for an excellent carrot cake recipe. I followed the recipe as written except that I substituted about 1/3 of the grated carrots with grated zucchini (fresh from the garden), and used pecans instead of walnuts. I also strained as much of the liquid from the crushed pineapple as possible because I was concerned that my zucchini substitution added extra moisture. I used freshly opened baking soda and powder. I used another Allrecipes recipe for Whipped Cream Cheese Frosting, as my frosting. The final product was EXCELLENT! Rave reviews from everyone.
The cake is great! I did reduce the oil to one cup. In a 9X13 pan, it is 40 minutes baking time. In a Bundt pan it took 55 minutes. This is one great cake!

I have made this cake for over 40 years and whenever I make it there is always someone that wants the recipe. My nephew did not like carrot cake but he ate almost the whole pan. I make it slightly different. I only use 1 cup of oil, 2 tsp. cinnamon and 1cups shredded coconut
This cake is WAY too oily, and I had to bake it 20 minutes longer than listed. People of Allrecipes if you changed the recipe to make this thing palatable, IT IS NOT A 5-STAR RECIPE.
Great recipe, my family enjoy when I make this cake.

I could not believe I MADE THIS CAKE! It was moist and tasty, my family loved it!

Following the directions was also very easy.
I have made this cake several times and I love this recipe!
Awesome recipe. I went with the recommendation to reduce oil by half and eliminated the coconut. It was still super moist and a hit for my family.
Very easy to make. Very moist.

Fabulous recipe! I followed some others and lessened oil and substituted applesauce.NO Need to do that. Cook slightly longer at same temperature ( all ovens different) 15-20 min. Cake will be perfect with no oily residue.. Follow this recipe and test your cake to make sure it is done.
I have made this recipe countless times. After the first few times, I cut half the oil and substituted it wil applesauce. The cake was still very tasty and moist. I LOVE IT!!!

Nice recipe! I added 1 mini snack box of raisins,1 tsp vanilla & a 1/2 tsp nutmeg which I found really added an additional flavor boost! I really loved the texture provided from all the carrots, walnuts & coconut flakes- but alas-it truly was a bit overly sweet & moist! All that moisture affected my pan release despite a non-stick Bundt pan & release spraying (top of it stuck badly). I will try the changes in heat and oil suggested by other reviewers. I won’t food process the pineapple chunks next time either! I really liked the brown sugar suggestions too. That was going to be among my next set of tweaks when I do this again -and I will be making this quick & easy carrot cake again!!
It was great! My co workers really like it and I didn’t even put any frosting on it!

It was a nice recipe and I believe that I’ve used these ingredients before and they seem to come out nice, and not too much sugar and was extremely easy for even the kids are doing a majority of the work !

I made this cake for the recent Easter dinner. I also used the "Cream Cheese Frosting II" recipe for the icing. The cake was very tasty. It was moist and delicious. I would make this again. I did need to bake it a bit longer than stated in the recipe (probably due to the oven).
THE BEST! It was the most moist carrot cake I have ever had. It was easy to make. The cream cheese frosting was literally 'the icing on the cake'! So good. Will definitely make this again!

I made a few changes. I only used 1/2 cup oil and substituted unsweetened applesauce for the rest and I used 1 cup regular sugar and 1 cup monk fruit sugar. I was making a few changes to make it a little healthier and I got rave reviews by family members.

Used 3/4 cup oil 
1 cup sugar 
Added 1 cup raisins
I made 6 different carrot cakes and this recipe cake in 1st place with my taste testers. I didn’t change a thing about the recipe. I did have to increase the baking time by 20 minutes.
I made this for a large birthday party (50 people) and absolutely everyone raved about it. Excellent recipe!!
I made this for the first time ever, for my boyfriend for his birthday and I hate carrot cake but this recipe with a few minor changes made me a lover.

Ok so here’s the tea I particularly didnt like it, it wasnt moist enough for me. So when I finish making them I didnt put icing on them bc like I said I didnt like it BUT my two children LOVED IT they ate both of them without icing and they enjoyed it! So I guess it just depends on preference
A little too much coconut.

I made it twice first time I substituted half of the oils for apple sauce and the second I substituted 3/4 of the oils for apple sauce. Both times it came out very moist and delicious. Highly recommend it

I’ve made this cake twice. The first time it came out good, but the second time it came out AMAZING! I had to tweak it to make it a tad bit more moist. I did use a mix of oil and apple sauce (had to tell myself it’s a healthier option so I wouldn’t feel so guilty). I did layer it with two 9in pans and baked for 30min. Pure heaven ladies and gents...... pure heaven.

Like many other bakers suggested, I cut down the oil to only 1 cup, and I used coconut oil for veggie oil, why not add some extra tropical flavor? I omitted the nuts and pineapple, I don't like pineapple in my carrot cake. But I added ground allspice, ginger and cloves, I love the extra zing of warm spices! Instead of a 13"x9" rectangular pan I used two 9" round pans to make a layered cake. Baked for 35 minutes and it came out beautiful!
Very Moist. It was a hit. Will make again..

I’ve made this carrot cake multiple times now. It’s always a hit. I’m one to alter recipes to how I see fit. The only thing I do differently to this recipes is I grate fresh coconut and I use 1 cup coconut oil, as opposed to the 1.5 cups vegetable oil. Other than that, I make it to a T and it’s always a hit. Thanks KORIBEAR for this recipe! It tastes great with the Cream Cheese Frosting II recipe found in this site as well.
The cake is excellent I made it twice I am about to make it to third time first I'm going to roll a big fat joint good for the munchies

I took note and decreased the oil amount, i used 1/2 cup unsweetened apple sauce, 1/2 cup oil. I omitted the raisins as my husbands hates them. I had fresh pineapple i used and strained. I cut back on the sugar as we like less sweet. I used cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice combo for my spices. I used the small snack carrots and chopped them in the blender. It came out nice and moist, with lots of flavor. Will be making again.

I followed the recipe as it was. (I read the too much oil comments after). We all liked it. I added some raisins to the batter and it was good. I made cream cheese frosting and topped it with the rest of the coconut. Everyone loved it.

It makes me crazy when people change the recipe then review their own. I followed this recipe exactly but used just 1/4 less oil because it seemed like a lot. It's a delicious, wonderfully moist cake but was still far too oily. Next time I will use only 1 cup oil or maybe less. And I used the "Basic Cream Cheese Frosting" recipe from this site. Very good.
It's the moistest and the best carrot cake. Just made the oil 1 1/4 cup and added some ground nutmeg, cloves and ginger.
this is my go to carrot cake I just love it and so does everyone else I added raisins if I don't have walnuts

This recipe is the best carrot cake recipe I have ever tried. It is so moist.
 Just a warning; one slice is NOT enough....I topped mine with a lemon & Phily Cream Cheese topping.
First carrot I ever made, I used two drops of Clove and ginger essential oils, I made one with ginger and cinnamon essential oils both were so good. My kids ate it up fast.

The only change I made was cutting out 1/2 cup of oil (I used 1 cup) and adding 4 oz more pineapple with juice. It still came out very moist without all the oil. Taste was wonderful. I will make this again.

Very moist! Took the advice of other reviewers, and reduced the oil to a scant 1 cup. I also subbed about half of the sugar with puréed fruit (pear and pineapple), and added some allspice and vanilla extract to give it more flavour (first time making it I did not change the flavourings and the cake tasted okay but lacking something). The result was a tasty carrot cake! My third attempt will be to reduce the oil again, try 1/2 cup oil and 1 cup apple sauce? This cake recipe tends to be on the oily moist side, but it’s worth playing around with the ingredient proportions; everyone enjoyed the cakes, with or without the cream cheese frosting !
Moist and delicious! I made with whole grain flour and brown sugar, and it turned out great! Thanks!
Made this for my girlfriend’s birthday. Incredibly tasty, and she loved it
We loved it!!!!
Best carrot cake recipe ever! I cut down the amount of oil in half and added raisins. This is the favorite in any party I make this for.

I have made this cake so many times, it is fantastic and delicious! I get consistent results with the moistness of the crumb. I have doubled and even tripled this recipe to make beautiful decorated sheet cakes for parties or birthdays. I did make two small changes in the recipe to suit my taste. I added a 1/3 cup of raisins, and also reduced the oil by a 1/4 cup. I still get outstanding results, with a lot rave reviews from all.
After reading several of the reviews I decreased the oil and used 1/2 cup oil and 1/2 cup applesauce. Turned out Excellent. Thanks for sharing the Recipe.
Great recipe!! I followed some of the others suggestion about the amount of oil and came perfect.
First time I tried to make carrot cake. Came out great! Loved the coconut . I had no idea coconut was in carrot cake.
I used the recommended 1/2 the oil and applesauce
Cut recipe in half and added raisins. The cake came out very moist.
used less oil (3/4 cup), less sugar (1.25 cup). instead of pineapple, added banana crush. The cake came out very well.
Way to OILY, I should of read the reviews first, I just wasted all those ingredients.

Very moist and flavorful cake! Like with any cake, it is better the next day. I did not drain carrots like others had said, however I drained pineapple and only used half the juice. I doubled the cinnamon because we love the spice and used lemon in my cream cheese frosting. I will keep this recipe forever!!!
Happy
I used flax eggs instead and I don't know if that made a huge difference but I didn't like it, too much oil also. Maybe next time I'll do something different less oil definitely

Very easy and delicious recipe 
I add frosting a lot of (cream cheese + sugar powder + vanilla extract) to give the cake more flavor
Refrigerate at least 12 hours before serving

Instead of oil I used 1 cup melted butter, and applesauce about 4oz. I didn’t shredded my carrots too small I used the 10oz shredded carrot package from Walmart. I love that I can actually taste the carrots!!! It came out great and moist. I think next time I’ll try it with some vegetable shortening!!
can i make it in round cake pans and whats the time

Really good carrot cake. I made this in round pans. I used 2 but 3 would have been better. The cake was moist and very tasty. The pineapple and coconut were just right. I don’t like raisins but I used then anyway. I used the white raisins as they are easier for me to eat. The cake was devoured. Will definitely make this again. I made the cake exactly as listed. The one thing I may have used 3 cups of carrots because it was hard to tell if I had 2 3/4 or 3 so I erred on the more side.
This carrot cake was absolutely amazing! I read the reviews and followed the recommendations from Mommy from seattle. Thank you!! Will definitely make again. Highly recommend.
I just left nuts out because my kids don’t like nuts in their carrot cake.,
Best one so far! Very moist and flavourful

I made a couple minor changes to the recipe that cut significant fat and calories from the cake and I do not think it had any negative consequences. I used a food processor and finely chopped the carrots... saved a ton of time and the results were near perfect. Instead of oil I substituted unsweetened applesauce. I believe it added a slight change to the overall flavor profile and I KNOW it reduced the fat and calorie count substantially. I also added 2 tsp of vanilla extract, because vanilla extract goes well in almost any cake recipe, right?! Rave reviews from everyone who tasted it. I also added 10 minutes of cook time, which I “think” may have been due to the applesauce instead of oil.
Very good Cake ... I did the half oil and half applesauce ... It was very moist .. only issue I had was I baked it 10 minutes longer than recipe and it was still a little uncooked in the center..

I cut the oil to 1 cup, sugar to 1 and 3/4 cups and I used light brown sugar on recommendation of others. 

I found the flavour of this cake to be nothing special. It lacked structural integrity and so didn't slice very cleanly. I think this is clear from other people's pictures as well. I served it with cream cheese icing and it was just too rich and sweet for the cake. 

Pineapple sounded like a great addition but I could barely taste it or find it in the cake and so I think more pineapple might have helped to make the cake a bit more interesting.

I might have enjoyed it more if I followed the recipe to a T but nonetheless, would not make again or recommend.
I used raw organic sugar and some stevia. Otherwise followed recipe. Moist, for sure, and delicious. Will make again.
Best carrot cake I've ever made - made it a few times now
Love this cake!!! I cut way down on the oil - I use the juice from the pineapple and some apple sauce! This cake is always a hit!!
Best carrot cake with NO modifications. Topped with cream cheese icing and took into the office. It's a favorite!
Love this recipe. This cake is so moist! I prepare it as directed, however, it does take a little longer than instructed.

Excellent recipe. 

I didn't include the coconut; but I regret that and will add coconut next time. I used /4 cup less oil and 3/4 cup less carrots.
Very moist with a wonderful taste

Awesome Cake. I changed the recipe a bit. Used melted butter/Margarine instead of oil and reduced the quantity to 1 cup. I did not use pineapple and walnuts. I used Cashew nuts instead and it gave a great taste. With cinnamon I mix half a teaspoon of cardamom powder, which gives nice flavor and aroma. I used freshly scarped coconuts as it is readily available in Sri Lanka and it gave a awesome taste and texture. Everyone loved the cake and I feel very happy every time I make it.

This is the best carrot cake I've ever had. I've actually tried the recipe three ways now, and in my opinion, the original printed recipe with 1 1/2 cups vegetable oil (I used canola/olive/grapeseed blend) is the best way to make it. My grandma said it's the best she's ever had! Even better than one of our favorite restaurants that is known for their scratch carrot cake. I tried the 3/4 cup applesauce, 3/4 cup oil version, and it wasn't bad, but the texture was too wet, not "moist" in the right way. And the applesauce flavor came through a bit making the cake taste kind of fruity. If you do the half applesauce version, I would recommend cutting the sugar down a little. The all oil version is also SO moist but also tender and rich. I also tried half melted coconut oil and half vegetable oil, but it actually wasn't as moist as all vegetable oil. Just stick with the printed recipe! Unless you plan on sitting down and eating half the cake to yourself, it really doesn't make THAT much of a caloric difference per piece. I mean, c'mon, it's carrot cake, I don't expect it to be diet food! :) I've baked in 2 9inch round pans and also a 9x13 - both good just increase the baking time.

Would def make again. Here are my changes: I've made it twice and liked the 2nd time better.
Used GF all purpose flour (Better Batter Brand)
For 1 1/2 cup oil, I substituted:
1 cup apple sauce
1/2 cup coconut oil
1/2 cup sour cream.
My can of pineapple was 20 ounces. I used the whole thing.
For the carrots, I didn't measure; I just shredded 3 large carrots and it looked "about right" and I tossed it in.
I also added 1/2 cup raisins
It was so moist, it doesn't need icing. I just put a little glaze on top to seal it.

Super easy to make. I will reduce oil/use apple sauce next time like others suggested. Also, will reduce coconut and increase pecans (did not use walnut) for the crunch, and maybe add raisins (need to figure out the right amount). This one is a keeper. Thanks!

I made a few minor changes, I cut back 1/4 cup of oil, 1/2 cup brown sugar, and 1 1/2 cup white sugar, I also soaked my raisins in pineapple juice. I made this cake every thanksgiving, and everyone loves it.

Very good but I cut the sugar down to 3/4 cup and and I used 1/2 cup coconut oil and 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce in place of all the oil and I added about 3/4 cup raisins turned out very good and very moist. I didn't use the coconut as the coconut oil gave it the the coconut flavor that flakes would of but you have to watch what oil you use as some have no flavor of the coconut I use Carrington Farms pure refined cold pressed 100% organic extra virgin

I used a bundt pan for this, which was a limited success. It was very full and took almost twice the baking time, but was a really pretty presentation. My family aren't fond of walnuts, so I used pecans instead, which was excellent. This is probably the best carrot cake recipe out there!

I decided to follow this recipe rather than substitute some of the oil as others had. It did seem like a lot, but I went with it anyway. The cake is delicious! Very moist and wonderful flavor and texture. I didn't find it to be "too moist", as others had said. My only complaint is it took much longer to bake in my oven for some reason. After the recommended baking time my center was still very much uncooked. I baked it another 20-25 minutes. Best thing about the cake is it gets more delicious the longer it sits.
Made this for my ladies group and there was no leftovers! I am not a coconut lover, so I substituted rinsed sauerkraut. No but me knew it, and had only good comments.
Delicious.
It was like soup after 40 minutes,,,,,,,cooked 20 minutes longer....I will cut down on the oil next time
I make it for the nursing home/ rehab that I work at and the employees and the residents love it

The best!!!! Everyone wants the recipe. I will never order carrot cake at a restaurant again. Nothing can ever come close. Please who claimed they did not like cake cake now love it. Well , mine. I always get the jaw drop "Oh my god" look at the first bite.

This makes quite a large cake, I didn't read the ingredients before I decided to double it... Now I have THREE of the most delicious carrot cakes! I don't think I'll have any trouble disposing of them ;) Haha. I didn't read any of the earlier reviews about decreasing the oil either, so I used the full amount but I don't think it's as oily as others have said. Next time I will half the oil quantity anyway just to cut back on some of the calories, but otherwise it's THE perfect carrot cake! I was also impressed that it rose so perfectly, very nice and even so it presents beautifully frosted with cream cheese icing :)

Great recipe!!! We've been juicing and the dry carrot shreds from carrot juicing were used here (great to dual-purpose =).

We've also been baking gluten-free and this recipe turns out *wonderfully* using the gluten-free All-Purpose flour recipe on AllRecipes (http://allrecipes.com/recipe/gluten-free-all-purpose-flour-mixture/).
We always cut down on oil in recipes, so we used 3/4 cup oil, and 3/4 cup unsweetened applesauce. Everything else as the recipe lists (did have to bake just a bit longer but one's oven is never the same as another's, so nothing abnormal).

YUMMY, YUMMY, YUMMY!!

This cake turned out great. I used pecans in place of the walnuts. Used 1/2 cup of oil with 1/2 cup of apple sauce. Baked it for 25 minutes at 350 in two 10 inch spring form pans. It turned out great.

Best carrot cake ever! I made recipe as is and did not think it was too much oil. I was a little worried after reading other reviews but I loved it. It wasn't too sweet. I did have to bake it for 50min and it was great. Made cream cheese frosting with 8oz cream cheese, 1 stick salted butter, 1 tsp vanilla and 1 cup powdered sugar.

I made this cake. I made the changes that most people recommended by cutting the oil to just one cup. Followed everything else exact. I took the advice to make two layers in 9 inch round cake pans so that it bakes better. Still had to bake it an extra 10min or so. Used a rum cream cheese frosting and people raved how great this cake was. It was moist and flavorful and not oily. I have to make another now due to demand.
